alert.note: Alert for Glascock; Hancock; Jefferson; Johnson; Warren; Washington; Wilkes (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 9:36AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Warren, east central Hancock, Glascock, Washington, southeastern Wilkes, northern Johnson and Jefferson Counties through 1000 AM EDT... At 936 AM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms extended from Cadley to near Mitchell to 6 miles west of Harrison, and moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Sandersville, Louisville, Warrenton, Gibson, Wrens, Wadley, Davisboro, Tennille, Harrison, Stapleton, Bartow, Avera, Norwood, Mitchell, Camak, Riddleville, Edge Hill, Edgehill, Hamburg State Park and Shoals. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.

area.areaDesc: Glascock; Hancock; Jefferson; Johnson; Warren; Washington; Wilkes
